channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Suella Braverman hits out after record migration figures
item.description: Ex-home secretary says government must "act now", after last year's net migration was estimated at 745,000.

item.title: Gaza war: Father of twins killed in Hamas attack says he is broken by deaths
item.description: The father of twins killed in the Hamas attack in Israel says he has been left broken by their deaths.

item.title: March wonky Christmas tree 'like leaning tower of Pisa'
item.description: One resident says the leaning Christmas tree could make the town famous.

item.title: Cleverly says he used 'unparliamentary' word about MP, not town
item.description: James Cleverly says he used a swearword to refer to a Labour MP, not to describe Stockton North.

item.title: Reading fire: Crane operator rescues worker next to burning high-rise
item.description: Videos from social media show the worker being lifted by a crane from the roof of a building.

item.title: Energy price cap will rise in January adding pressure on households
item.description: A new domestic energy price cap has been announced leading to higher bills for millions.

item.title: Dutch election: Anti-Islam populist Geert Wilders wins dramatic victory
item.description: The veteran politician says "we will govern" after his Freedom party doubles its seats in parliament.

item.title: Ozempic: Man arrested in 'skinny jab' ingredient raids
item.description: Officers seize vials thought to contain semaglutide - the main ingredient in weight loss drug Ozempic.

item.title: Covid: Lack of trust in government adversely affected minorities - Badenoch
item.description: The business secretary tells the Covid inquiry some minority groups did not trust the government.

item.title: Harry Maguire: Manchester United star accepts apology from Ghana MP Isaac Adongo
item.description: Isaac Adongo had compared his vice-president's economic policies to the Manchester Utd star's performances.

item.title: Geert Wilders' victory in Netherlands election spooks Europe
item.description: EU leaders should take note but it's too simplistic to say populists are taking over, says Katya Adler.

item.title: The minister, the iPad and the £11k roaming bill - the story so far
item.description: Scotland’s health secretary has been embroiled in a scandal over his work iPad's huge roaming bill.

item.title: The Chinese mafia's downfall in a lawless casino town
item.description: For years the "four families" ruled a town notorious for scam centres in Myanmar - their end was swift.

item.title: Doctor Who: David Tennant says returning for 60th anniversary is 'a treat'
item.description: The actor, who left the show in 2010, is back for three specials celebrating its 60 years on air.

item.title: Gunmen and sexism: On the road with Mexico's women truckers
item.description: Less than 3% of global lorry drivers are women. In Mexico, some are challenging stereotypes behind the wheel.

item.title: Chris Mason: Does the Autumn Statement hint at spring election?
item.description: The chancellor's plans have fuelled talk of an early poll, our political editor Chris Mason writes.

item.title: The electronic noses designed to prevent food poisoning
item.description: Tech firms have developed AI-powered sensors that can detect bacteria in food.

item.title: Macy's Thanksgiving Parade: Annual event stars SpongeBob and minor protest
item.description: This year's Macy's event in Manhattan was briefly disrupted by a small pro-Palestinian demonstration.

item.title: Moment flash mob ransacks Nike store in Los Angeles
item.description: The thieves stole $12,000 (about £9,500) worth of merchandise.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity: Nella Rose says Nigel Farage is 'anti-immigrants'
item.description: YouTuber Nella Rose questions Nigel Farage's politics on jungle reality TV show I'm a Celebrity.

item.title: NHS staff failed mum who died from drinking too much water
item.description: Michelle Whitehead's husband believes she would still be alive if staff had monitored her properly.

item.title: Betsi Cadwaladr health board criticised over Weetabix death
item.description: Coeliac Hazel Pearson died four days after having the cereal for breakfast at Wrexham Maelor.

item.title: Dumfries and Galloway medicinal leech find 'incredibly important'
item.description: It is the first time the medicinal leech has been found in Dumfries and Galloway.

item.title: Pakistan charging refugees $830 to leave
item.description: Pakistan is charging undocumented refugees an $830 exit fee to leave the country if they arrived without a visa.

item.title: Missing Ukrainian child traced to Putin ally
item.description: A two-year-old taken from a children's home has been adopted by politician Sergei Mironov, BBC discovers.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton: Mercedes driver denies Red Bull approach claims by Christian Horner
item.description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton denies claims by Christian Horner he approached Red Bull about a move there earlier this year.

item.title: Stokes opts to skip 2024 Indian Premier League
item.description: England Test captain Ben Stokes makes himself unavailable for the 2024 Indian Premier League to manage his workload and fitness.

item.title: Chantelle Cameron v Katie Taylor 2: Irishwoman vows to grasp 'second chance' in rematch
item.description: Katie Taylor promises a "completely different fight" against Chantelle Cameron in their rematch on Saturday.

item.title: West Indies v England: Matthew Potts replaces Josh Tongue in squad for ODIs
item.description: Matthew Potts replaces seamer Josh Tongue in England's squad for the one-day international series against West Indies in December.

item.title: Premier League goals from Americans Tim Howard, Brenden Aaronson and Clint Dempsey
item.description: As the United States celebrates Thanksgiving, BBC Sport takes a look back at some of the best Premier League goals by Americans.

item.title: Euro 2024 qualification: Wales drawn against Finland in play-off semi-final in Cardiff
item.description: Wales will face Finland in a Euro 2024 play-off semi-final on 21 March in Cardiff and will also be at home if they reach the play-off final.

item.title: Use our energy calculator to work out how much you'll pay next year
item.description: Use our interactive calculator to find out how much more you'll be paying for energy each month.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and what will happen to bills in January?
item.description: The price cap which sets typical annual household energy bills will rise from January.

item.title: When should I turn the heating on?
item.description: As it gets colder here are some tips to help you stay warm while trying to keep your energy bills down.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Energy saving tips: Five ways to cut costs this winter
item.description: Energy prices will be lower this winter than last - but you may be able to save even more on your bill.

item.title: Allow more aid into Gaza, Lord Cameron urges Benjamin Netanyahu in Israel
item.description: The UK foreign secretary offers Israel support, but also calls for civilian casualties to be minimised.

item.title: Palestinian-Americans struggle with survivors' guilt
item.description: The war in Gaza is leaving relatives in the US struggling with a number of emotions including guilt.

item.title: Gaza hostages deal: 'Until I see them with my own eyes I won't believe anything'
item.description: Relatives of those held anxiously wait to see if their loved ones will be among the captives freed.

item.title: Hamas hostages: Stories of the hostages taken by Hamas from Israel
item.description: From elderly grandparents to young children, these are the people known to have been taken captive.

item.title: Yahya Sinwar: Who is the Hamas leader in Gaza?
item.description: Thousands of Israeli troops are trying to find the man who heads the organisation's political wing.

item.title: How the Israel-Hamas hostage deal came together
item.description: The "excruciating process" involved four countries, spy masters and presidential calls, a US official says.

item.title: Lebanon PM says Israeli strikes killed journalists
item.description: Two journalists and two other civilians are killed as exchanges of fire intensify along the border.

item.title: BBC assesses footage of hostages and tunnels released by Israel
item.description: BBC Verify assesses footage of a tunnel and hostages released by Israel to prove Hamas used Gaza's al-Shifa hospital as a command centre.

item.title: What we know about the hostage deal
item.description: The agreement should see Hamas release 50 hostages during a four-day pause in fighting in Gaza.
